Comment: Reconstructed as C-initial by Gildea & Payne (2007). Second syllable only occurs in some contexts in some languages.
Only C-initial Sa verb in Proto-Cariban. Second syllable only occurs in some contexts in some languages.
Reflexes of *ətjəpɨ. *ətepɨ, *jəpɨ, *epɨ, *əpɨ are found throughout the family. *ət is identifiable as an (optional) prefix.
Originally Sp, but switched to Sa in some languages.
Older copula form, co-occurring with be-2.
Newer copula root, co-occurring with be-1.
Regular derived Sa verb, except in Pekodian
Replaced by 1w in many languages, switched places in Tiriyó and Akuriyó.
Switched to Sa verb in Tiriyó, in Bakairí with addition of DETRZ, potentially also in Panare.
